oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Oklahoma Roundup - 1948-04-22 - KOMA
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance from the Oklahoma Roundup radio program on April 22, 1948 on radio station KOMA (Oklahoma City, Okla). Staff includes Perry Ward (master of ceremonies), Allan Page (announcer, director), and Kenyon Brown (producer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chuck Davis; Roundup Boys; Lexie Lou and Ray; Julian Akins; Lem Hawkins; Cowboy Jess
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) Opening statements and theme / (1:08) Perry Ward introduces Chuck Davis / (1:19) Chuck Davis and the Roundup Boys perform "Red Wing" / (3:00) Perry Ward introduces the Ozark Sweethearts / (3:39) Lexie Lou and Ray perform "Going Back To Texas" / (5:35) Perry Ward introduces Julian Akins / (5:55) Julian Akins performs "South" / (7:35) Perry Ward and Julian Akins tell a joke / (8:50) Lem Hawkins performs "Down At The Railroad Tracks" / (11:14) Perry Ward tells a joke / (11:32) Cowboy Jazz [phonetic] performs "Jole Blon" / (13:37) Perry Ward introduces the next song / (13:53) [Unidentified] performs "Arkansas Traveller" / (14:22) Closing statements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Oklahoma Roundup; KOMA (Radio station : Oklahoma City, Okla.); CBS Inc.; Davis, Chuck; Ward, Perry, 1914-1989;
